results.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
results.brief_description: A Las Vegas team of forensic investigators are trained to solve criminal cases by scouring the crime scene, collecting irrefutable evidence and finding the missing pieces that solve the mystery.

results.title: Crystals: flowers of the mineral kingdom
results.brief_description: Discusses the shape of crystals, depicts frost farming and goes on to show simple applications of crystals. The relationship between crystal properties and uses is illustrated with aluminium.

results.title: Crystals: an introduction
results.brief_description: Introduces the subject of crystals by demonstrating the orderly arrangement of atoms in the crystalline state and the relation of this arrangement to the physical properties of the substances.

results.title: Crystals and their structures
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Chemical Education Material Study Education Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Crystals have plane faces, sharp edges, sharp melting points, and may cleave easily to give new plane surfaces. They also interact with x-rays to produce well-defined diffraction patterns. Experiments are performed in a ripple tank on an unknown crystalline array so that the student sees the principles and measurements by which actual crystal structures are determined. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crystals and their growth
results.brief_description: Crystals of quartz, granite, snow and salt are used to show the nature and growth of crystals and their importance in modern science and technology. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crystals
results.brief_description: This film shows us the various processes by which crystals are formed, including that of salts in solution by evaporation; of rock formations by percolation of water through the earth; of the melting and cooling of minerals; and the crystallisation of substances in solutions contained in the cells of various plants. Actual crystallisation is recorded by means of time-lapse micro-cinematography.

results.title: Crystallization
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard, Dimension Films and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: The filming of magnified forms of crystals of common solutions as they are seen forming and then melting in polarized light captures the natural evolving shapes in a kaleidoscope of colour and in an infinite series of abstractions. Visually fascinating, all process were filmed at low magnification. Music by Phil Bishop, microphotography/crystalography by Robert R. Forrester and narration by Marguerite Ray. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crystal diode (Episode 4)
results.brief_description: Looks at the effect of a voltage in the barrier region, rectification of current by a crystal diode; the diode characteristic; and rectification of a sine wave. From the “Semiconductor Physics” series, part 4.

results.title: Crystal clear
results.brief_description: Traces in detail the making of sugar from the planting and cultivating of the sugar cane to harvesting, the milling process, storage and shipping, the refining process and the distribution of refined sugar products. Most of the commentary in this film is given by people who actually work in the sugar industry. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Crying within
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A narrative of a schizophrenic girl’s struggle to come to terms with her unstable mind and her wish to have a better life. She speaks of a faceless person, her other self, who goads her into self-mutilation and as a result suffers a recurring nightmare. A disturbing tale of the struggles of coming to terms with dealing with inner voices.
